intro: Cryptantha jamesii var. multicaulis, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, thriving in full sun. It has a low, spreading growth habit with multiple stems arising from the base, and its leaves are narrow and hairy. The species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
